bug.author: jayschwa
bug.summary: "Upgrading your code to TensorFlow 2.0" is behind a Medium paywall
bug.description:
<denchmark-h:h2>URL(s) with the issue:</denchmark-h>
<denchmark-link:https://medium.com/tensorflow/upgrading-your-code-to-tensorflow-2-0-f72c3a4d83b5>https://medium.com/tensorflow/upgrading-your-code-to-tensorflow-2-0-f72c3a4d83b5</denchmark-link>
<denchmark-h:h2>Description of issue (what needs changing):</denchmark-h>
This upgrade guide is linked from the TensorFlow 2.0 release notes. If the viewer has exceeded their quota on Medium, they are blocked by a paywall and cannot read the upgrade guide. Is this intentional? <denchmark-link:https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/475017/65907458-68883c80-e392-11e9-82d0-edf8ad7efbe0.png></denchmark-link>

comments.comment:
<denchmark-link:https://github.com/jayschwa>@jayschwa</denchmark-link>
Did you get a chance to go through Tensorflow official website. <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/guide/upgrade>https://www.tensorflow.org/guide/upgrade</denchmark-link>
I suggest updating the release notes to link to <denchmark-link:https://www.tensorflow.org/guide/upgrade>https://www.tensorflow.org/guide/upgrade</denchmark-link> instead of the Medium post.

Yes we're working on moving the blog because of this sort of thing. If you think this change is important you can send a PR to update: <denchmark-link:https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/RELEASE.md>https://github.com/tensorflow/tensorflow/blob/master/RELEASE.md</denchmark-link>
Ugh, sorry to see that. There's a switch I think we can flip on articles to prevent it - perhaps we missed it. Will take a look.
Should be fixed now, thanks again for flagging!
